seriesJson.title: Reader's almanac
seriesJson.description: A literature series featuring interviews with authors, poets, and others in the literary world.

node.title: Gladys Brooks
node.description: Gladys Brooks discusses If Strangers Meet, a biography of her life with her husband Van Wyck Brooks.

node.title: Ben Lucien Burman
node.description: This program focuses on author and journalist Ben Lucien Burman.

node.title: M.L. Rosenthal
node.description: This program focuses on poetry anthologist M.L. Rosenthal.

node.title: Ladislas Farago
node.description: This program focuses on Ladislas Farago, author of Patton, Broken Seal and other works.

node.title: Shane Stevens
node.description: This program focuses on Shane Stevens, author of Go Down Dead.

node.title: May Lee Settle
node.description: This program focuses on author Mary Lee Settle.

node.title: Saul Stein
node.description: This program focuses on Saul Stein, editor of publishing house Stein and Day.

node.title: Paul Hyer
node.description: This program focuses on architect Paul Heyer, who often wrote about his craft.

node.title: May Sarton
node.description: This program focuses on poet and novelist, May Sarton.

node.title: Rudi Blesh
node.description: This program features Rudi Blesh, a biographer of Buster Keaton.

node.title: Jessamyn West
node.description: This program features Jessamyn West, author of The Friendly Persuasion.

node.title: John Hall Wheelock
node.description: This program features poet John Hall Wheelock.

node.title: David Douglas Duncan
node.description: This program features photographer, David Douglas Duncan.
